text:
Bush was fading for days, not getting out of bed and not eating. When his friend Jim Baker showed up yesterday morning, he perked up.

“Where are we going, Bake?” he asked.

“We’re going to heaven,” Baker answered.

“That’s where I want to go,” Bush said.

text: What prompted FBI Russia inquiry? "It was not, as Mr. Trump and other politicians have alleged, a dossier compiled by a former British spy hired by a rival campaign. Instead, it was firsthand information from one of America’s closest intelligence allies."

text: "...documents and information that would incriminate Hillary and her dealings with Russia and would be very useful to your father. This is obviously very high level and sensitive information but is part of Russia and its government's support for Mr. Trump"

text: Good question! Depends on whether the VP has other stops or events. If it's just a one-off when they both overlap, it may not be necessary to have a second pool.

text: "I have watched with dismay and increasing horror as my nephew ... has become the architect of immigration policies that repudiate the very foundation of our family’s life in this country," writes Stephen Miller's uncle.

text: Which president was it who hired "a lowlife like Omarosa" onto the White House staff again?
author: peterbakernyt

text: From son of blue-collar small-town mayor to jet-setting international consultant to Trump campaign chief to prisoner on trial, the trajectory of Manafort's life is tale of greed, deception & ego. ⁦⁦@SharonLNYT⁩ ⁦@kenvogel⁩ ⁦@maggieNYT⁩

text:
Did Trump talk with Comey about Flynn or not?

Giuliani to ⁦@GStephanopoulos⁩ last month: "What he said to him was, ‘Can you give him a break?’” 

Giuliani to ⁦@jaketapper⁩ on Sunday: "That’s crazy. I have never said that."

⁦@maggieNYT⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Ryan passed historic tax cuts. What else does he see as his accomplishments in the Trump era? “I can look myself in the mirror at the end of the day and say I avoided that tragedy, I avoided that tragedy, I avoided that tragedy,” he tells @MarkLeibovich
author: peterbakernyt

text:
Is the economy doing well? Yes, it continues to.

Jobs created during last 18 months of Obama presidency: 3.7 million.

Jobs created during first 18 months of Trump presidency: 3.4 million.

⁦@PatcohenNYT⁩

text: I find I'm actually reading more books as an antidote to social media. In fact, turning off now to get back to the latest -- "The Woman's Hour," a gripping history of the suffrage movement.

text: Days after the House impeached Clinton, Kavanaugh predicted the Senate would acquit and urged Starr not to indict Clinton until he left office. ⁦@shearm⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: “My public persona was in my being a Fox News Channel contributor. My real persona was something else.” The rise and fall of a television commentator secretly working as a covert operator. @keithkloor
author: peterbakernyt

text: In less than two weeks, Mueller’s prosecutors have laid bare the lying, cheating, and stealing by the people he chose to run his campaign and inauguration. ⁦@sbg1⁩

author: peterbakernyt

text: "Chain migration"? Trump wants to end it. But his in-laws just used it to become US citizens. “It stands for a bedrock of our immigration process when it comes to family reunification," says their lawyer. ⁦@anniecorreal⁩ ⁦@ESCochrane⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Love the @Slate Slow Burn podcast series on Watergate? The fabulous @lneyfakh is back with season 2, focused on the Clinton impeachment.

text: White House @PressSec briefed just three times last month for an average of 19 minutes each time. @JasonSchwartz
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump claims to get along well with Rosenstein: "It's fantastic. We have a great relationship. Make sure you tell them that."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump’s lawyers reject Mueller's latest terms for an interview in the Russia investigation, countering with an offer that suggests a narrow path for answering questions. ⁦@nytmike⁩ ⁦@maggieNYT⁩

text: Trump gave Rand Paul a letter of introduction to Putin. "In the letter, the president mentioned topics of interest that Senator Paul wanted to discuss with President Putin,” said White House spokesman @hogangidley45
author: peterbakernyt

text: The @nytimes added another 109,000 net new subscribers in the second quarter, bringing total to 3.8 million digital and print.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Leaked document shows that Putin expressed desire to make progress on arms control during Helsinki meeting with Trump. “This is, ‘We want to get out of the dog house and engage with the US on a broad range of security issues.’” @BryandBender
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump suggests his tariffs will allow him not just to balance the budget but actually begin to pay down the overall national debt accumulated over decades. ⁦@jimtankersley⁩ explains why the math doesn't even come close to that.
author: peterbakernyt

text: With Indra Nooyi's departure from Pepsi, just 24 of the 500 biggest companies on S&P will have a woman as CEO. ⁦@andrewrsorkin⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: While many in the West rush to embrace Saudi Arabia's volatile young crown prince as a "reformer," he makes clear he will not tolerate criticism of Saudi intolerance. ⁦@NYTBen⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Gates testifies that he and Manafort held 15 foreign bank accounts that were not disclosed to the federal government and that required financial filings were not submitted “at Mr. Manafort’s direction.” @SharonLNYT @ESCochrane
author: peterbakernyt

text: Deficits are helping to boost growth by pumping money into the economy but they could come with long-run costs. ⁦@NickTimiraos⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Increase in consumer spending, driven by rising incomes and strong confidence, is causing some retailers to expand. ⁦@EricMorath⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Fueled by a strong economy and Trump tax cuts, S&P companies saw their profits jump 23.5 percent in the second quarter. ⁦@tgryta⁩

text:

text:
Trump-dictated statement, July 2017: "We primarily discussed a program about the adoption of Russian children that was active and popular with American families years ago."

Trump, August 2018: "This was a meeting to get information on an opponent."

text: "Once we start shooting you f—ers you aren’t going to pop off like you do now," said the voice in ⁦⁦@BretStephensNYT⁩ voicemail. "You’re worthless, the press is the enemy of the United States people."
author: peterbakernyt

text: At economy’s nadir in 2009, unemployment among high school dropouts hit 15.6 percent. In July, unemployment for this group fell to 5.1 percent, the lowest since government began collecting such data in 1992. ⁦@NelsonSchwartz⁩ ⁦@bencasselman⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: There is Trump’s foreign policy, and then there is the foreign policy of the rest of the Trump administration, backed by the Republican Party. This week, the two were openly at odds with each other. ⁦@MarkLandler⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Short tells ⁦@sbg1⁩ that he thinks a lot of the backlash to his U-Va. post has to do with Trump’s “unique presidency" and the “raw emotions” in Charlottesville; he hopes to contribute to “an honest conversation about how this presidency came to be.”
author: peterbakernyt

text: Economy added 157,000 jobs last month, somewhat below expectations, as unemployment rate falls to 3.9 percent. ⁦@NelsonSchwartz⁩  https://nyti.ms/2O8JoDO?smid=nytcore-ios-share …

text: Honored to be on @mitchellreports as she marks 40 amazing years of journalism. What makes Andrea stand out is she remains a reporter's reporter -- always pounding the pavement, working the phones, making the grueling trips and pushing for information. An inspiration to all of us.

text: Alan Alda says he was diagnosed with Parkinson's three and a half year ago but has "had a full life since." ⁦@alexmarshall81⁩
author: peterbakernyt

author: peterbakernyt

text: GOP leaders thought they had a deal with Trump to delay a confrontation over a border wall until after the midterm. And then instead Trump threatened to shut down the government this fall if he does not get the money. ⁦@SherylNYT⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: AG told Trump that his "dangerous and harmful" attacks on a free press went beyond legitimate criticism and were endangering journalists here and abroad: "I warned that this inflammatory language is contributing to a rise in threats against journalists and will lead to violence."
author: peterbakernyt

text:
Trump: "We just opened up Europe for you farmers."                   
EU spokeswoman: "Agriculture is out of the scope of these discussions."

text: Economy grew 4.1 percent in the second quarter of the year, matching one goal set by Trump in the best three-month performance since 2014. ⁦@bencasselman⁩

text: Trump administration actually does have a coherent foreign policy in some areas, one ally tells ⁦@sbg1⁩. "The problem is, one cannot too long separate the strategy from what the president is going to say and do at any given moment."
author: peterbakernyt

text: White House says US Air Force C-17 containing remains of fallen service members has departed Wonsan, North Korea, in a "first step" of repatriation. Statement does not say how many troops' remains are on the plane out of the 5,300 Americans still missing from the Korean War.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Elliott Abrams makes the case for why Trump would be right to revoke the security clearances of former officials who criticize him.

text: That truce in Trump's trade war with Europe came as big three US automakers downgraded projections citing costs associated with tariffs. ⁦@nealboudette⁩
author: peterbakernyt

author: peterbakernyt

text: In statement, White House @PressSec acknowledges barring CNN reporter @kaitlancollins because she “shouted questions and refused to leave” Oval Office at end of pool spray. If that’s the standard, they will have to bar every member of the press pool since that’s what all of us do
author: peterbakernyt
peterbakernyt

text: Outrageous of the White House to bar @CNN reporter @kaitlancollins from an open press event because it did not like her questions. A strong leader does not fear questions. A strong democracy does not shield its leader from those who question authority.
author: peterbakernyt

text: WHCA President @OKnox on barring reporter from event: "This type of retaliation is wholly inappropriate, wrong-headed, and weak. It cannot stand. Reporters asking questions of powerful government officials, up to and including the President, helps hold those people accountable."
author: peterbakernyt

text: On Air Force One, Trump railed at his staff when he spotted a TV tuned to CNN instead of Fox. The person watching CNN? Melania. ⁦@katierogers⁩ ⁦@maggieNYT⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Other than Bush 43, Trump has the highest approval rating within his own party at this stage of his tenure of the last nine presidents. ⁦@MichaelCBender⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Days after saying he really does accept the findings of the intelligence agencies that Russia intervened in the election, Trump walks back the walk back and says again that "it is all a big hoax."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Huntsman rejects suggestion by columnist for his brother's newspaper that he resign: "I have taken an unscientific survey among my colleagues ... about whether I should resign. The laughter told me everything I needed to know." (h/t ⁦@playbookplus⁩ )
author: peterbakernyt

text: Was the National Enquirer acting as a news organization or a campaign ally of Trump's when it paid an accuser $150,000 and effectively silenced her before the 2016 election? Authorities are asking. ⁦@jimrutenberg⁩ ⁦@benprotess⁩
author: peterbakernyt

author: peterbakernyt

text: "The disturbing thing is, this is just one part of the private conversation we know about, and think about how cockamamie it was,” McFaul tells ⁦@sbg1⁩. “... So why wouldn’t we assume the rest of the conversation was like that as well?”
author: peterbakernyt

text: Cohen secretly taped Trump two months before the election discussing payments to a former Playboy model who said she had an affair with the candidate. Giuliani says Trump did nothing wrong. ⁦@mattapuzzo⁩ ⁦@maggieNYT⁩ ⁦@nytmike⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Did Trump and Putin make secret agreements or not? “It is terribly disturbing,” a senior US official tells ⁦@sbg1⁩. “The point is that we don’t know.” https://www.newyorker.com/news/letter-from-trumps-washington/the-trump-putin-summit-and-the-death-of-american-foreign-policy …
author: peterbakernyt

text: “Not awful. Not great,” says @thejoesexton. Huh? The Nats should have won the World Series and are struggling this year, but they still have second-best record in baseball over last six years and four division titles. That’s a little better than mediocre.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump: "The Summit with Russia was a great success, except with the real enemy of the people, the Fake News Media."
author: peterbakernyt

text: White House announces $3.9 billion deal to buy two new Air Force One planes and claims credit for saving $1.4 billion. But in 2015, the estimated cost was just over $3 billion.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Fascinating debate inside the Washington Post editorial board: @RuthMarcus says Trump advisers should resign https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/quit-now-trump-staffers-save-your-souls/2018/07/16/6529cb3a-8920-11e8-85ae-511bc1146b0b_story.html?utm_term=.66d129fc9e70 … and @hiattf says they should stay.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump's motive seemed to be to fight, tooth and claw for the legitimacy of his 2016 election. ⁦@MarkLandler⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: "This is Putin's fourth US president and this is the summit he has dreamed of for 18 years." Andy Higgins ⁦@StevenErlanger⁩
author: peterbakernyt

text: Not since the Civil War when John Tyler went over to the Confederacy has the word "treason" been raised about a president in such a prominent way.
author: peterbakernyt

text: After Trump's meeting with Putin, critics cry "treason." https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/17/us/politics/trump-critics-treason-putin.html …
author: peterbakernyt

text: That's not an insult, it's an observation and one offered with no disrespect. The point is this a very restrained career public servant who has been so upset at what he has seen that he has become far more outspoken than he ever was before.
author: peterbakernyt

text: As Trump makes nice with Putin, his Justice Department charges a Russian woman who tried to broker secret meetings between the two during the 2016 campaign with carrying out a secret Russian effort to influence American politics. @mattapuzzo @ktbenner
author: peterbakernyt

text: Ed Royce, the retiring GOP foreign affairs chairman: "I disagree with the president’s comments. There is simply no comparing the actions of the United States and Vladimir Putin."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Ryan: "There is no question that Russia interfered in our election and continues attempts to undermine democracy here and around the world. ... The president must appreciate that Russia is not our ally. There is no moral equivalence between the United States and Russia."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Great job by @JonLemire, thanks for asking the tough questions.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Not a new thought but worth noting again that Trump was far harsher on American allies Germany and Britain than he just was on Russia.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Asked if Russia has compromising information on Trump, Putin does not answer, saying instead only that he did not personally know that Trump was in Moscow when he visited as a private businessman.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump: “President Putin was extremely strong in his denial today.” And Putin offered to have his investigators work with US investigators. “I think that’s an incredible offer.”
author: peterbakernyt

text: Asked if he would condemn Russia for its intervention, Trump instead criticizes FBI and talks about the Democratic server and Hillary Clinton’s deleted emails.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Fabulous job by @jeffmason1 today.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Putin says he wanted Trump to win the election: "Yes I did. Yes I did. Because he talked about bringing the US-Russia relationship back to normal."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Putin just raised Bill Browder without being asked, attacking him and his associates for making money illegally and contributing it to Hillary Clinton.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Regarding the 12 Russian military intelligence officers identified and indicted by the United States, Putin says, “I will look into it."
author: peterbakernyt

text: The consensus conclusion by US intelligence agencies that Russia intervened in the US election? “This is utter nonsense,” Putin says. “… There’s no evidence when it comes to the actual facts."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump repeats his refrain that there was “no collusion.” Worth remembering that his son, son-in-law and campaign chairman accepted a meeting explicitly advertised as the Russian government offering incriminating information about Trump’s opponent to help him win the election.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump keeps casting Russia’s election intervention in terms of a Democratic excuse for its defeat, not in terms of a foreign power’s actions.
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump repeats that the Mueller probe is responsible for trouble in the Russian-American relationship, not Russia’s intervention in the election: “The probe is a disaster for our country. It’s kept us separated."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Does Trump hold Russia responsible for anything? @jeffmason1 asks. “I hold both countries responsible."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump says that when he described Russia as a “competitor,” he meant it to be “a compliment."
author: peterbakernyt

text: Trump says he and Putin spent a lot of time talking about the Russian interference, expresses no criticism of Moscow’s actions.
author: peterbakernyt

text: With Trump at his side, Putin again denies US election intervention: “The Russian state has never interfered and is not going to interfere into internal American affairs including election process. Any specific material, if such things arise, we are willing to analyze together."
author: peterbakernyt
